definition: to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: When the wind blows , the slender tree bends but never breaks.
sentences.chinese: 起風時，這棵細長的樹常彎曲但決不會斷。

sentences.english: "Never say never" is one of my new expressions.
sentences.chinese: 如今，“決不說‘決不’”成了我新的口頭禪之一。

sentences.english: "Never say never" is one of my new expressions.
sentences.chinese: 如今，“決不說‘決不’”成了我新的口頭禪之一。

sentences.english: By no means will this method produce satisfactory results.
sentences.chinese: 這種方法決不會產生令人滿意的結果。

sentences.english: We must respect the history of China, must not cut off history.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須尊重中國的歷史，決不能隔斷歷史。

sentences.english: That's why you should never consider it beneath you to revisit the moneymaking basics.
sentences.chinese: 因此你決不能忽視對盈利基本要素的再度審視。

sentences.english: Here’s the deal: black, brown, and navy are all neutrals.
sentences.chinese: 決不要把黑色與棕色或深藍色搭配在一起。

sentences.english: Tail is docked and well set on, carried gaily but never over the back.
sentences.chinese: 斷尾，歡快地舉着，但決不能翻卷在背上。

sentences.english: Don't blame me for going to court since we can't settle it between us.
sentences.chinese: 我們之間的問題解決不了，休怪我到法院去起訴。

sentences.english: We shall never submit to slavery.
A tourniquet should never be used.
Keep them as clean and as sharp as your knives, and they will never steer you wrong.
sentences.chinese: 保持你的刀清潔和尖利，決不會讓你作錯了。

sentences.english: He'll never fade, like the daytime mirages.
sentences.chinese: 他決不會像白晝的海市蜃樓一樣逐漸消逝。

sentences.english: Never suppose low voltage cannot quite possibly be dfuryous.
sentences.chinese: 決不能以爲高壓電沒危境。

sentences.english: He is an honest man, and he never has an ax to grind.
sentences.chinese: 他是個不達目的決不罷休的人。

sentences.english: Will not damage car finish, so your car is beautiful as new.
sentences.chinese: 決不損傷汽車漆面，令您的愛車靚麗如新。

definition: in no way/not in the least/absolutely not
preferably/one would prefer to...(or not to...)/would rather/(would) be better to/(to pick) the lesser of two evils
conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
